events.name: Projective Tests Training
events.description: Projective tests are psychological measurement tools used to understand individuals' inner worlds, thoughts, feelings, and perceptions. These tests generally use open-ended and multifaceted materials to allow individuals to express themselves freely, providing insights into personality traits, emotional states, and subconscious thoughts. Below, you will find information about the recommended projective tests for your training program and their main features.

events.name: Working with Trauma in Children
events.description: In this training, the theoretical background of trauma in children and adolescents, how children experience trauma, what to consider during assessment and intervention stages, structured games that can be incorporated into the psychotherapy process while working with trauma, and case presentations will be addressed.

events.description:

events.name: Objective Tests Training
events.description: The training content includes a total of 18 tests. In this training, you will learn how to apply, score, interpret, and evaluate the tests, and how to provide feedback through presentations, case analyses, application examples, and visuals. The importance of guidance as much as applying tests is emphasized in this training. Upon completing this training, you will be able to understand children more closely. You will have the opportunity to make objective and concrete evaluations in areas of abilities such as intelligence, memory planning and attention, language and motor skills, and visual and auditory perception.

events.name: Perla Book Club (Attachment: The Science of Finding and Keeping Love)
events.description:
Hello everyone 📚

We are excited to share some enjoyable and exciting news with you. This month we are meeting for our book club at @psikolojiperla 🎊

Our theme: Relationships

Our book: 'Attached: The Science of Finding and Keeping Love' by Amir Levine and Rachel Heller.

This fascinating book helps us understand attachment styles (secure, anxious, and avoidant) in relationships and offers practical strategies for developing healthy relationships. In our club, we will discuss how attachment styles are shaped by past experiences, how to build trust in relationships, and how to harmonize different attachment styles. We will also focus on the insights and suggestions the book offers on anxious and avoidant attachment styles. We invite everyone to join this deep and enlightening discussion!

Note: To join the book club, you only need to be a book lover. No expertise or profession is required. 🤞

For information and registration, please fill out the form. 💐 Our quota is limited to 20 people. 🤞

events.name: Child Drawing Analysis and Drawing Techniques
events.description:
The Child Drawing Analysis and Drawing Techniques Practitioner Certificate Program will be conducted by Cln. Psk. Pınar Gümüş Sarı on 6-7 July.

Program Introduction
It aims to explain the use of children's drawings from a psycho-pedagogical perspective to understand the child and guide the work carried out with the child. It conveys to the participants what the important indicators in the drawing mean for the experts and the points to consider in the interpretation of the drawing.

events.name: Brief Solution-Focused Therapy
events.description:
The brief solution-focused approach consists of a set of special techniques that therapists and counselors use during the counseling process. These techniques help the client focus on their strengths and moments when the problem is not experienced and are supported by various tasks and exercises. The approach is based on the perspective that 'Problems are experienced, solutions are found' and takes momentum from the client to achieve change. The client is encouraged to try ways they have never tried before in solving the problem, remember periods when the problem was manageable, and positive aspects are revealed to achieve change and contribute to sustaining this change. The focus is on the 'Here and Now,' not the past and future.

* Only psychology and psychological counseling and guidance students and graduates can participate in our programs.

* Supervision is planned as a single day outside of the program days. A 3-hour supervision session will be held with the participants 2 weeks after the training.

events.name: MMPI Certification Program
events.description:
Hello from the Academic Event Team of İGÜ Psychology Club!

Although ADHD is more common in children, it is a type of neurological disorder that also makes daily life difficult for adults, known as hyperactivity among the public, causing the individual to be overly active and frequently experience attention deficit. Various environmental, genetic, and brain structure-related factors can be the source of this disorder.

You are invited to our event where we will try to understand ADHD with the narration of Psk. Elif Berfin Beyhan.

⏱️ Time: 14:00
📍 Event Location: J block 311
